definition: to vow before one's troops
oath/vow/to swear/to pledge
teacher/master/expert/model/army division/(old) troops/to dispatch troops
surname Shi

sentences.english: Over 200 youth members join the kick-off ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 超过二百名青年会员进行誓师仪式。

sentences.english: The rulers of Xia Dynasty administer their oaths in the army for they want their people to be mentally prepared.
sentences.chinese: 夏启在军中誓师，是为了使军队事先有思想准备。

sentences.english: Puma son also successfully from the hand of the director to the pledging conference defend the deployment diagram.
sentences.chinese: 彪子也成功的从导演手中拿到了誓师大会保卫部署图。

sentences.english: The Democrats held a pep rally on Capitol Hill yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 民主党昨天在国会山召开了竞选誓师大会。

sentences.english: The officiating guests also officiated the Pledge Ceremony of the exchange tour.
sentences.chinese: 主礼嘉宾在典礼中同时主持北京交流团的誓师仪式。

definition: in command of the army
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
punitive expedition to the south
meetings conducted by rulers in feudal China for the purpose of formalizing alliances, finalizing treaties
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to circulate (a protest or call to arms)/to promulgate
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
(in former times) upper, middle and lower army/army of right, center and left/(in modern times) the three armed services: Army, Navy and Air Force
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
to brandish a spear
to celebrate a heroic deed
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
to send troops
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
